articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: De Villiers wins Dakar Rally 2nd stage, Terranova new leader
articles.description: Orlando Terranova of Argentina has become the new Dakar Rally leader in Saudi Arabia after finishing second on the second stage to Giniel de Villiers of South Africa
articles.content:
He finished four minutes behind 2009 champion Giniel de Villiers of South Africa, who earned his 15th career stage win.
De Villiers benefited from a navigation error in the last kilometers by local driver Yazeed Al Rajhi, who led the entire stage to that poi… [+1628 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Israel advances nearly 2,000 settlement homes, watchdog says
articles.description: An anti-settlement watchdog group says Israeli authorities have advanced plans to build nearly 2,000 new homes in the occupied West Bank
articles.content:
According to Peace Now, the projects include retroactive legalization of two small outposts that were built without authorization.
The Israeli defense body that oversees civilian affairs in the occupied West Bank, known as COGAT, did not immediately respond … [+1385 chars]

articles.author: Aaron Blake
articles.title: John Bolton’s big announcement on testifying — and what it means
articles.description: Bolton saying he'll testify to the Senate may not matter, if he won't be called. But he might have made it easier for the House to subpoena him.
articles.content: Experts say Boltons decision to say he would abide by a Senate subpoena could undermine any claims he might have to fight a House subpoena. The Democratic-controlled House has thus far declined to subpoena him, but only because he has indicated he would allow… [+4944 chars]

articles.author: Jason Samenow, Wes Junker
articles.title: Burst of wet snow likely Tuesday afternoon. Light accumulation possible.
articles.description: Snow could slow the early part of the Tuesday evening commute, but most accumulation should focus on grassy areas.
articles.content:
This winter so far has been practically snowless, and, over the past two weeks, almost every day has exceeded 50 degrees. But a burst of snow Tuesday afternoon into the early evening will offer a reminder of the season.
The snow should not be too disruptive,… [+4072 chars]
